Class Machine

java.lang.Object
  Machine

public class Machine
extends Object

A pinball machine, with a sample demo

Version:
23/03/2017
Author:
821148

Method Summary
 void addObject(MachineObject newObject)
          Add an object to the array list
 void addPinball(Pinball newPinball)
          Add a pinball to the array list
 void checkCollisions()
          Iterates through the array list of pinballs and checks if it has collided with all objects on the machine
 void draw(Pinball pinballObj)
          Draw an PinballObject at its current position onto the view of the pinball machine
 void drawMachine()
          Draws all of the walls onto the machine.

          Draw an MachineObject at its current position onto the view of the pinball machine

          Draws a string and allows a custom font to be set.
 void erasePinball(Pinball pinballObj)
          Erase a PinballObject from the view of the pinball machine
 int getBottomWall()
          Returns the edge of the bottom-hand wall
 int getLeftWall()
          Return the edge of the left-hand wall
 int getRightWall()
          Return the edge of the right-hand wall
 int getTopWall()
          Return the edge of the top-hand wall
 int getTotalPoints()
          Retrieves the total points by adding all the pinball's points together through the array list
 void movePinballs()
          Moves all pinballs in the array list
 void pauseMachine()
          Introduces a small delay in ball movement, for smooth running
 double positionDifference(MachineObject firstObject, MachineObject secondObject)
          Calculates the difference between the positions of two objects
 double radiusDifference(MachineObject firstObject, MachineObject secondObject)
          Square the sum of the radius of two objects and returns the value
 void resetMachine()
          Resets the machine back to initial view, with no pinballs
 void startMachine()
          Runs the simulation checking all collisions before moving all pinballs in the array list If the game has ended, the score will be printed.

positionDifference

public double positionDifference(MachineObject firstObject,
                                 MachineObject secondObject)
Calculates the difference between the positions of two objects

Parameters:
firstObject - The current Pinball being checked for collision
secondObject - The object that is being checked against the current Pinball
Returns:
Returns the differenc between the positions of two objects using their x/y coordinates

radiusDifference

public double radiusDifference(MachineObject firstObject,
                               MachineObject secondObject)
Square the sum of the radius of two objects and returns the value

Parameters:
firstObject - The current Pinball being checked for collision
secondObject - The object that is being checked against the current Pinball
Returns:
Squared sum of radiuses of both pinballs

resetMachine

public void resetMachine()
Resets the machine back to initial view, with no pinballs

startMachine

public void startMachine()
Runs the simulation checking all collisions before moving all pinballs in the array list If the game has ended, the score will be printed.
